questions: Write in brief about wildlife sanctuary.
answers: Wildlife sanctuaries provide protection and suitable living conditions to wild animals.  Sanctuaries are places where killing  or capturing of animals is strictly prohibited.  Indian sanctuaries have unique landscapes-broad level forests, mountains forests and bush land forests, in deltas of big rivers.  Some of the threatened wild animals such as black buck, white eyed buck, elephant, golden cat and pink headed duck are protected and preserved in our wildlife sanctuaries.

questions: Explain how deforestation leads to reduction rainfall.
answers: Plants need carbon dioxide for photosynthesis. Fewer trees would means that less carbon dioxide is used up resulting in its increased amount in the atmosphere. This leads to global warming as carbon dioxide traps heat rays reflected by the earth. The increase in temperature on the earth disturbs the water cycle and may reduce rainfall.
